bibl.title: Letter from Emilie Lawrence Reed to Howard A. Kelly, November 12, 1922

div1.p: Emilie Lawrence Reed seeks a pension increase. She writes about Marie Gorgas' pension and discusses the public stature of William Gorgas.

div1.head: Letter from Emilie Lawrence Reed to Howard A. Kelly, November 12, 1922
div1.p:
I have just
lately returned from my
summer home & have
been presented by the
Walter Reed Hospital
with the enclosed papers.
It always pleases me
so much when I see
how year by year your
beautiful tribute to
Walter Reed, lives on.

The Walter Reed Hospital
is now a great insti-
tution, & I dont care
where I go, the name
is well known & reverenced.
I am going the last
of the year to visit
my daughter in Texas,
but before my departure
I am going to put in
my plea for an increase
of my pension.

Congress has recently given
Mrs Gorgas $150.00 per month
BURLINGTON HOTEL
WASHINGTON, D.C.
while I receive only $125-
why should Gen Gorgas'
work be rated higher than
Walter Reed's when every one
knows that the Panama Canal
could not have been built
but for my husband's dis-
covery. It hurts me to
feel that Congress so rates
the work of the two men.
Should you be coming over
to Washington, I would so
love to see you.
